definition: on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)

sentences.english: He handed in a summary of the civil engineering project to the higher authorities.
sentences.chinese: 年底，他向上级交上了一份土建工程的总结。

sentences.english: Some officers lashed out with batons and shields, but their superiors restrained them.
sentences.chinese: 一些警察挥动着警棍和盾牌，但被他们的上级阻止了。

sentences.english: One of the first things that your supervisor may do is to introduce you to co-workers.
sentences.chinese: 你的上级首先可能做的事情之一是把你介绍给同事。

sentences.english: You should show greater respect for your elders and betters .
sentences.chinese: 你应该对长辈和上级尊重些。

sentences.english: But ha was stripped very quickly by superior army authority, jiangchen be demotinged.
sentences.chinese: 但哈儿很快被上级剥夺了军权，被贬江城。

sentences.english: He acted without reference to his superior.
She appealed to a higher court.
DeSalvo gets a call from his superiors giving Jack permission to interrogate the prisoner.
sentences.chinese: 迪沙佛接到上级的电话，批准了杰克审讯维克托。

sentences.english: He was chided by the superior because he had violated the company's bylaws.
sentences.chinese: 他因违反公司的规章制度遭到上级的挥斥。

sentences.english: Well with superior departments and the competent departments of public security communication and relationship.
sentences.chinese: 同时做好与上级部门和公安主管部门的沟通和联系。

sentences.english: The position will report to the BSR Beijing Director and be based in the Beijing office.
sentences.chinese: 汇报上级是BSR北京总监，工作地点在北京办事处。

sentences.english: A month later, he took his findings back to his superiors.
sentences.chinese: 一个月后，他带着调查结果返回到他的上级部门。

sentences.english: So a mentor can't be the mentee's supervisor or a project leader.
sentences.chinese: 因此导师不能是被辅导者的上级或项目领导。

sentences.english: His rise through the ranks was helped by the fact that he never hesitated to decapitate a superior.
sentences.chinese: 他毫不犹豫杀死上级的行为帮助了他的晋升。

definition: to report to one's superiors/to appear in the news/to reply to a letter
to report/to give an account of/report
to report/to give an account of/to collect information and report back
to promote to a higher position
to transmit down (a chain of command)/to pass down (to lower level)/to issue/to send through
